title: Centos 7 libjson-c build failure
body:
Build failure
``` bash
==> Installing libjson-c
==> Using cached archive: spack/var/spack/cache/libjson-c/libjson-c-0.11.tar.gz
==> Staging archive: spack/var/spack/stage/libjson-c-0.11-6kxjkfdqpwot5vdijbs6ueuwwdjncues/json-c-0.11.tar.gz
==> Created stage in spack/var/spack/stage/libjson-c-0.11-6kxjkfdqpwot5vdijbs6ueuwwdjncues
==> Ran patch() for libjson-c
==> Building libjson-c [AutotoolsPackage]
==> Executing phase : 'autoreconf'
==> Executing phase : 'configure'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    'spack/var/spack/stage/libjson-c-0.11-6kxjkfdqpwot5vdijbs6ueuwwdjncues/json-c-0.11/configure' '--prefix=spack/opt/spack/linux-centos7-x86_64/gcc-4.8.5/libjson-c-0.11-6kxjkfdqpwot5vdijbs6ueuwwdjncues'
spack/lib/spack/spack/build_systems/autotools.py:266, in configure:
     258      def configure(self, spec, prefix):
     259          """Runs configure with the arguments specified in
     260          :py:meth:`~.AutotoolsPackage.configure_args`
     261          and an appropriately set prefix.
     262          """
     263          options = ['--prefix={0}'.format(prefix)] + self.configure_args()
     264
     265          with working_dir(self.build_directory, create=True):
  >> 266              inspect.getmodule(self).configure(*options)

See build log for details:
  spack-stage-yggXWT/json-c-0.11/spack-build.out
 ```

Logs
``` bash
checking for a BSD-compatible install... /bin/install -c
checking whether build environment is sane... yes
checking for a thread-safe mkdir -p... /bin/mkdir -p
checking for gawk... gawk
checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... yes
configure: error: source directory already configured; run "make distclean" there first
```

```make distclean``` isn't portable in this case because the Makefile was configured to use /bin/ksh, which isn't installed on many systems.

I could work around it with ```rm config.status``` which will cause configure to lose its state and re-run.
